pros: Great place to be employed, good benefits, and part of an amazing team of coworkers.
cons: At this time I don’t have any cons.

pros: The campus is very beautiful and they have signs throughout that promote positive and encouraging messages.
cons:
Where do I begin?
I would just say that after my personal experience and reading many Glassdoor reviews, it is obvious, in my opinion that Masonic is turning a def ear and blind eye to employee concerns. My experience was, my supervisor NEVER listened to concerns I brought forth. I became concerned over my personal safety at a certain point and asked for that concern to be followed up on.,and was figuratively given a pat on the head and dismissed.
Unfortunately, from my personal experience, no one cared that I expressed personal safety issues. In my opinion, the management may read these reviews and present a Glassdoor response to contact them directly so they can problem solve these reviews. Unfortunately , in my opinion, it is just a way for them to try and give the appearance they care, when In my own experience, I know better. In my opinion a new management team across the board is needed. In my opinion, I would keep looking for other alternatives to gainful employment and bypass Masonic Home.

pros: Great management team, striving to improve daily. Administrator is energetic and involved. Staff work together and complete their tasks and help others to grow.
cons: Staffing as like any other facility. Distance.

review_title: Shelbyville used to be the crown jewel.
pros: The residents make it enjoyable.
cons: Management makes it unbearable. Very clique-y and they hire incompetent people for lower wages and work is always passed off to the next person.

pros: I cannot think of pros at this time
cons: Incidents regarding racist and sexist statements made by the President that were reported to human resources however there was no disciplinary action taken.

pros: They had very Flexible scheduling.
cons: Very unorganized when it came to different units.

job_title: Resident Caregiver in Masonic Home, KY
pros: flexible with schedules and residents are nice.
cons: short staffed some days and the pay is not good.

pros: I have worked at Masonic Homes of Shelbyville for almost 11 years. It has changed over the years, but one thing reminds the same we work together as a family to take care of our neighbors. Masonic Home has great benefits and the company wants to help make you grow. They offer many ways for you increase your education or move up positions in the company. There is a lot of room to grow with this company.  The Administrator at Shelbyville and managers care about their workers and neighbors.
cons: None that I can think of. Every job has ups and downs at times. It is just how you deal with them.

pros: I love working with seniors and I love the people I work with. Every job has its own special "challenges" but here, I feel like my opinion matters and I am part of the team. I have many many years left in my career and I plan on retiring from here eventually. I love this place.
cons: Every job has its own challenges, but I feel like what I do and what I say matters here. Not really a con, but what can I say, I love this place!

review_title: Masonic home has always encouraged my growth and showed appreciation for the work I do.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Shelbyville, KY
pros: Masonic home takes great pride in providing above and beyond care to the residents they serve, and showing appreciation of the staff that serves the residents and families.
cons: No Cons, great place to work. Great people to work with and I’m proud to work here.

job_title: Director of Environmental Services in Shelbyville, KY
pros: Masonic has a reputation that speaks for itself, we offer great services for our neighbors and takes care of its employee's.  I have been here for 8 years and I wouldn't and do not want to work anywhere else.
cons: All employers have challenges, staff challenges and work loads, but we make it work and move on and learn from our mistakes.

pros: Masonic Homes of Shelbyville is a wonderful company to work for! They invest in their employees and the team in Shelbyville all work together for the greater good of the resident! I would strongly recommend working here as well as placing a loved one here.
cons: None at the present time

pros: The residents are great and are so appreciative of all the hard work the staff does.
cons: The treatment of staff. Management and HR knows of the bullying, abusive, and hostile work environment created in the Independant Living buildings with little to NO action.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Louisville, KY
pros: Great pay, good hours plenty of OT if you're looking for that sort of thing.
cons: Rude residents and clics of employees who wont help you if they decide they dont like you.   Insurance sucks bad too

pros: Working with a company that cares about their residents and employees
cons: I have no issues at this time
